result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: filed by Attorney Jonathan LaVoy
Hearing on November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:44 AM Defendant Michael Y Liu in court.  Attorney Joseph R Kennedy in court for Michael Y Liu.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin.  Victim Victim A appeared by zoom audio.  Attorney Lindsey M Anderson appeared by zoom video for Victim A. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 
Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Court addresses bail motion.  
Atty. Kennedy requests bail be modified as to contact with victims B and C.  
State objects to the modification of bail conditions.
Atty. Anderson replies for victim A and objects to modification of bond conditions.
Victim A agrees that  Atty. Anderson spoke correctly for victim A.
Atty. Kennedy makes final argument for modification of bail conditions.
Court denies the modification of bail conditions and bail to remain in effect as ordered on 8/4/2022.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Hearing on November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter from Atty Anderson
Zoom request **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 9/8. "granted"
Atty Lindsey Anderson

Motion to Modify Bond
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/07/22 - To be addressed by CC Costello on 9/9 following the preliminary hearing.*
Preliminary hearing on September 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.

APPLY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT.  DEFENDANT PREVIOUSLY POSTED $5,850.00.  REMAINING CASH BOND TO BE REFUNDED TO THE POSTER.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Victims/Witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, with the exception of contact through Our Family Wizard for information as it relates to the minor children and the minor children only.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 0.5 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant is responsible for payment of GPS.  Defendant to report to WCS before the end of business today.  Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.

01:14 PM Defendant Michael Y Liu in court with attorney Joseph R Kennedy.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  The Court will not allow for the third party contact with the Victim as it relates in Waukesha County Case 22CV1055.  The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant. Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:15 am.
